snippet: The grounding is the latest in a long string of delays that has plagued the Air Force’s newest, and most advanced, fighter aircraft.
abstract: Defense Department grounds its fleet of F-35 fighter jets after one of them catches fire during takeoff at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida; grounding, second in a month, is latest in long string of delays that has plagued the Air Force’s newest fighter aircraft.

byline.original: By ANDREW SIDDONS and HELENE COOPER

lead_paragraph: The grounding is the latest in a long string of delays that has plagued the Air Force’s newest, and most advanced, fighter aircraft.

headline.main: New Delay for F-35 Jets as Defense Department Grounds Fleet After a Fire
headline.print_headline: New Delay for F-35 Jets as Defense Department Grounds Fleet After a Fire

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
